item.title: Nitrous Oxide cannisters left on street, 2nd July
item.description:
After the midnight to 2am (?) party/rave in the street (early hours of 2nd July) scores of Nitrous Oxide cannisters have been left littering the street. A few years ago this substance was banned for recreational use as a Class C drug.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pembury Close, Hackney, London

item.title: Dead branches either fallen or in danger of falling onto pedestrians, 2nd July
item.description:
The beds along Elmers End road close to the railway line have trees which are in need of attention. There are dead branches, or dying branches, some over hanging the pavement. One has fallen next to the seat. Another tree slightly further from the rail line has dying branches - third photo. Also a tree on the other side of the road - slip road to the station is dead. No room for photo of that.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmers End Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins overflowing, 2nd July
item.description:
Dear Greenwich Council, I am writing as a British citizen and a resident of the area to raise a serious concern regarding the ongoing rubbish problem along the path near this area. The current situation is unacceptable. The bins are constantly overflowing, and there is visibly no space for proper disposal. Rubbish ends up scattered all over the area and even reaches the river, creating not only an eyesore but a clear environmental hazard. This is not a one-off occurrence—it’s like this all the time. It is obvious that the current number and size of bins are not sufficient for the level of public use in this area. I am therefore requesting that you urgently install more and larger bins to help manage the waste more effectively and keep the area clean for both residents and visitors. If no action is taken, I will have no choice but to escalate this to the media. I believe the residents of Greenwich deserve better, and I trust you will treat this matter with the seriousness it requires. I look forward to seeing improvements soon.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Highbridge Wharf, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Would it be possible for you to put up signs telling dog owners to clean up after their dogs?, 2nd July
item.description:
Would it be possible for you to put up some signs encouraging dog owners to clean up after their dogs? The roads that really need these are :Ashmore Road, Bravington Road, Denholm Road, Fernhead Road, Fordingley Road, Portnal Road, Saltram Crescent and Shirland Road. Some of these signs have been pulled down by dog owners who have taken offence!! This is especially true in Shirland Road. Thank you in anticipation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Fernhead Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet
